sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些词均有"在周围，在附近"之意。
means: about ：既可表静态，也可表动态。
around ：主要用于美国，静态或动态均可。
round ：主要用于英国，多半指动态。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些副词均有"大约，差不多"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: almost, nearly, about, approximately, around, roughly
means: almost ：指在程度上相差很小，差不多。
nearly与almost含义基本相同，侧重指数量、时间或空间上的接近。
about ：常可分almost和nearly换用，但about用于表示时间、数量的"大约"时，实际数量可能多也可能少。
approximately ：多用于书面语，指精确度接近某个标准以致误差可忽略不计。
around ：多用于非正式场合，常见于美国英语。

sentence.Network_en: On Sunday Cohen lay around the house all day.
sentence.Network_cn: 科恩星期天一整天都在家无所事事。

sentence.Network_en: They were knocking around together for about a year.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们交往大概有一年了。

sentence.Network_en: He had twined his chubby arms around Vincent's neck.
sentence.Network_cn: 他胖乎乎的双臂搂住文森特的脖子。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)have a lot of varied experience and understanding of the world
Having had many and varied experiences
jx.jx_cn_mean: 经验丰富，老于世故：具有丰富经验和不同经历

lj.lj_ly: a young executive who has been around.
lj.lj_ls: 一个经验丰富的年轻经理

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : from a- 'in, on' + round

entry.def: To be positioned around a place or object means to surround it or be on all sides of it. To move around a place means to go along its edge, back to your starting point.

example.ex: She looked at the papers around her...
example.tran: 她看了看四周的文件。

example.ex: Today she wore her hair down around her shoulders.
example.tran: 今天她的头发披在肩上。

entry.def: If you move around a corner or obstacle, you move to the other side of it. If you look around a corner or obstacle, you look to see what is on the other side.

example.ex: The photographer stopped clicking and hurried around the corner...
example.tran: 摄影师停止按动快门，匆匆绕过拐角。

example.ex: I peered around the edge of the shed — there was no sign of anyone else.
example.tran: 我仔细察看了棚子周边，没有其他人。

entry.tran: 朝着相反方向；向着对立面
entry.def: If you turn around, you turn so that you are facing in the opposite direction.

example.ex: I turned around and wrote the title on the blackboard...
example.tran: 我转过身，在黑板上写下了题目。

example.ex: He straightened up slowly and spun around on the stool to face us.
example.tran: 他慢慢直起身子，坐在凳子上转过身来面对着我们。

entry.def: If you move around a place, you travel through it, going to most of its parts. If you look around a place, you look at every part of it.

example.ex: I've been walking around Moscow and the town is terribly quiet...
example.tran: 我在莫斯科到处游逛，城里非常安静。

example.ex: He glanced discreetly around the room at the other people.
example.tran: 他谨慎地瞥了一眼房间里的其他人。

entry.def: If someone moves around a place, they move through various parts of that place without having any particular destination.

example.ex: These days much of my time is spent weaving my way around drinks parties...
example.tran: 这些天，我多半都是在酒会上晃悠过去的。

example.ex: They milled around the ballroom with video cameras.
example.tran: 他们扛着摄像机在舞厅里转来转去。

entry.def: If you go around to someone's house, you visit them.

example.ex: She helped me unpack my things and then we went around to see the other girls.
example.tran: 她帮我打开行李，然后我们去看望其他女孩们。

entry.def: You use around in expressions such as sit around and hang around when you are saying that someone is spending time in a place and not doing anything very important.

example.ex: I'm just going to be hanging around twiddling my thumbs...
example.tran: 我只会闲呆着，什么事也不做。

example.ex: After breakfast the next morning they sat around for an hour discussing political affairs.
example.tran: 第二天早饭后，他们闲坐着聊了一个小时政治话题。

entry.def: If you move things around, you move them so that they are in different places.

example.ex: Furniture in the classroom should not be changed around without warning the blind child...
example.tran: 教室中的桌椅如需要挪动，应事先告诉这个盲童。

example.ex: She moved things around so the table was beneath the windows.
example.tran: 她挪动家具使桌子靠在窗边。

entry.def: If a wheel or object turns around, it turns.

example.ex: The boat started to spin around in the water.
example.tran: 船开始在水中打旋。

entry.def: You use around to say that something happens in different parts of a place or area.

example.ex: Police in South Africa say ten people have died in scattered violence around the country...
example.tran: 南非警方称，在全国各地零星发生的暴力事件中，有10人死亡。

example.ex: Elephants were often to be found in swamp in eastern Kenya around the Tana River.
example.tran: 在肯尼亚东部的塔纳河一带经常发现陷入沼泽的大象。

entry.def: If someone or something is around, they exist or are present in a place.

example.ex: The blackbird had a quick, wary look in case the cat was anywhere around...
example.tran: 这只乌鸫迅速警惕地张望了一眼，以防那只猫就在附近。

example.ex: Just having lots of people around that you can talk to is important...
example.tran: 有许多能交谈的人在身边很重要。

entry.def: The people around you are the people who you come into contact with, especially your friends and relatives, and the people you work with.

example.ex: We change our behaviour by observing the behaviour of those around us...
example.tran: 我们通过观察周围人的举止改变自己的行为。

example.ex: Those around her would forgive her for weeping.
example.tran: 她身边的人会原谅她掉眼泪的。

entry.def: If something such as a film, a discussion, or a plan is based around something, that thing is its main theme.

example.ex: ...the gentle comedy based around the Larkin family...
example.tran: 根据拉金一家的故事改编的轻喜剧

example.ex: The discussion centered around four subjects.
example.tran: 讨论围绕4个主题展开。

entry.def: You use around in expressions such as this time around or to come around when you are describing something that has happened before or things that happen regularly.

example.ex: Senator Bentsen has declined to get involved this time around...
example.tran: 这次本特森参议员又拒绝参与。

example.ex: When July Fourth comes around, the residents of Columbia City throw a noisy party.
example.tran: 每逢7月4号美国独立日，哥伦比亚城的居民们都会举行热闹的聚会。

entry.def: When you are giving measurements, you can use around to talk about the distance along the edge of something round.

example.ex: She was 40 inches around the hips.
example.tran: 她臀围40英寸。

example.ex: My salary was around £9,000 plus a car and expenses...
example.tran: 我的薪水大约是9,000英镑，还有一辆车和业务经费可支配。

example.ex: Rolls Royce produces around 1,000 extremely desirable cars a year.
example.tran: 劳斯莱斯公司每年生产约1,000辆非常吸引人的汽车。

example.ex: There is a Green party but it only scored around about 10 percent in the vote...
example.tran: 虽然有一个绿党，但在选举中该党只得到了大约10%的选票。

example.ex: He's charging you around about a hundred pounds an hour for his services.
example.tran: 他提供一小时服务，要价大约100英镑。

entry.def: You say all around to indicate that something affects all parts of a situation or all members of a group.

example.ex: He compared the achievements of the British and the French during 1916 and concluded that the latter were better all around.
example.tran: 他比较了1916年英国人和法国人的成就，结论是法国人在各方面都做得更好。

entry.tran: 见过世面；经验丰富；老于世故
entry.def: If someone has been around, they have had a lot of experience of different people and situations.

example.ex: He knows what to do. He's been around...
example.tran: 他知道该做什么。他阅历很丰富。

example.ex: He's been around a long time and has acquired a number of skills.
example.tran: 长久以来他见过很多世面，学了很多技术。

means.word_mean: 2. by a circular or circuitous route;

sentences.sentence: "He came all the way around the base"

means.word_mean: 3. to or among many different places or in no particular direction;

sentences.sentence: "wandering about with no place to go"
"he needs advice from someone who's been around"

means.word_mean: 4. in a circle or circular motion;
5. (of quantities) imprecise but fairly close to correct;

sentences.sentence: "I've had about all I can stand"
"20 or so people were at the party"

means.word_mean: 6. in or to a reversed position or direction;
7. to a particular destination either specified or understood;
8. all around or on all sides;

sentences.sentence: "It rains all year round on Skye"

example.en: I didn't do anything but rat around all summer.
example.zh: 我整个复天啥事也没干，就是到处转悠。

list.explanation: (军队用语)被复杂、琐碎、无谓的事纠缠得脱不了身的

example.en: He was involved in their messy troubles and got wrapped around the axle.
example.zh: 他被卷进了他们那些乱七八糟的纠纷里，弄得脱不了身。

example.en: He's been at the job for two years but still doesn't know his way around.
example.zh: 这工作他虽然已经干了两年，但还是不大懂门道。

example.en: I think if you'll stick around you'll get a seat sooner or later.
example.zh: 我认为如果你能在附近等待一下,那你早晚会谋到个职位的。

auth_sentence.content: Everybody was scared and people began to run around.
auth_sentence.res_content: Everybody was scared and people began to run around.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Everybody was scared and people began to run around.

auth_sentence.content: Nike's whole golf proposition was built around him.
auth_sentence.res_content: Nike's whole golf proposition was built around him.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Nike's whole golf proposition was built around him.

auth_sentence.content: Neptune Bright blue clouds speed around the outermost planet.
auth_sentence.res_content: Neptune Bright blue clouds speed around the outermost planet.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Neptune Bright blue clouds speed around the outermost planet.

sentences.cn: 我看见附近一个人也没有。

sentences.en: I'll be back at around 5 o'clock.

means.word_mean: (表示位置)围绕, 绕在; 在…各处, 在…范围之内; 在…附近, 在…周围
(表示方向)绕过, 越过; 朝…的四周, 往…的四周

sentences.en: Let's go around the town, not through it.
sentences.cn: 我们从城外绕过去, 不要穿城而过。

means.word_mean: (表示状态)包着, 裹着; 在…身边, 接近(某人)

sentences.en: I bound the cloth around my head to stop the bleeding.

means.word_mean: (表示依据)以…为中心, 根据

sentences.en: Their society was built around a belief in God.
sentences.cn: 他们的社会建立在信仰上帝的基础上。

jushi.english: I'll be back at around 5 o'clock.
